name: df-dchr
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cdchr, cmpt(s0, cn, csb(s1, cfv(czn, cv(s0)), csb(s3, crab(s2, co(cfv(cmgp, cv(s1)), cmhm, cfv(cmgp, ccnfld)), wss(cxp(cdif(cfv(cbs, cv(s1)), cfv(cui, cv(s1))), csn(nat0)), cv(s2))), cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cv(s3)), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), cres(cof(cmul), cxp(cv(s3), cv(s3)))))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ DChr =(s0 ∈ ℕ ↦[(Z/nZ ` s0)/ s1][{ s2 ∈((mulGrp ` s1)[MndHom](mulGrp ` CCfld))|(((Base ` s1)\(Unit ` s1))× { 0 })⊆ s2 } / s3]{ <(Base ` ndx), s3 >, <(+ ` ndx),(oF(×)|`(s3 × s3))> })
comment: The group of Dirichlet characters ` mod n ` is the set of monoid homomorphisms from ` ZZ / n ZZ ` to the multiplicative monoid of the complex numbers, equipped with the group operation of pointwise multiplication. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Apr-2016.)
